column4: I've never done it, but this page talks about formatting a usb: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Installation/FromUSBStick
I've never done it :-). Does gparted see the device?
try 'sudo fdisk -l' <--- that's a lower case L. Wanna pastebin the output?
now tell us the url it gave you :-)
good, your device is /dev/sdb1. You can try 'sudo fsck /dev/sdb1' but I don't know how much checking you can do on a FAT16 filesystem...
well, what happened when you typed 'sudo fsck /dev/sdb1' ?
see, told you first time was the hardest! That's a perfectly good fsck, since the word 'error' doesn't appear anywhere. Go on to the next step in your instructions. Which web page are you using, btw?
a fedora system? Or are you using fedora instructions on Ubuntu :-)
I'm not convinced the instructions are valid for lucid. What about https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Installation/FromUSBStick instead?
well, it's already formatted to fat16 according to fdisk, and fsck thinks it's ok. so does unetbootin read it?
please rerun 'sudo fdisk -l' again and repaste...
I'm not qualified to advise you any further. In your place, I'd google the error message and see if anything useful shows up...
yup, that's pretty conclusive. Good to know for future reference too...
